Granted, I've used Canon's for a long time, so I may just be used to how they focus with pressing the button halfway and taking a picture instantly when you press all the way.-It locked up on me 3 times in 7 days.  2 times it locked up while on and while I was out snorkeling.  Wouldn't turn off and all the buttons stopped working.  I had to get back to the boat and remove the battery and pop it back in.  Of course I missed some good footage of dolphins because of it!  The third time it would try powering up and then power back down.  I discovered that a few grains of sand jammed up the lens cover preventing it from opening.  I had to gently "help it along" under running water to get it unstuck.-No tightening feature on the wrist strap.  Not a biggie, since I just tied a knot in it to make it harder to slip off.Overall, I'm not impressed at all, b/c you're paying the premium for it to be "tough" and sacrificing on picture video quality compared to the latest digicams.  Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: perfect!!!!!!  (for the first month)
Reviews.Author: olympus camera hater
Reviews.Content: wow!! this camera is just great. the first month was just spectacular  :)  untill it started to break...........................................................................where do i start?!??!?!well first of all..never buy this camera or any other olympus waterproof camera because they are not really waterproof!!!!the second time i used this camera in the water the screen got really blurry for about 10 mins then just wouldnt turn back on.so i let it sit and air dry for 5 days then tried to use it and it worked fine. about 4 months later i used it in a pool, i was under water taking a pic and a message came up on the screen,"card cover is open". right away i new that wasnt good so i took it out of the water and turned it off, made sure the battery compartment was closed shut and turned it back on, but the message was still there.  :(  so again i let it sit for a couple of days but the message was still there.  then i shipped it off to technical service very dissapointed because i was going on a trip the next day and really wanted my camera. when i came back from my trip..yay!!! it was all fixed......but not for long....about ten minutes after i turned it on for the first time since i got it back the camera shut off by itself!  so...i turned it on and guess what happened.......??????........a message came up on the camera screen............."card cover open"...but i checked and the card cover was closed shut so i sent it back for the SECOND TIME and am still waiting for it to return.okay so second of all.....my sister bought the same camera except it was the stylus tough 6020..which certainly is not better then the 6000. the first time she brought it into the ocean. for a short amount of time the camera said that it was not connected (whatever that means).......but then it started to work again and finally!!!...water got in it...like you could see the water if you tilted the screen ..it was stuck inside the camera!!!! ..so we just sent that one to technical service and are hoping that they can actually fix it!in conclusion you should never buy an olympus waterproof camera because they stink!!!

Reviews.Title: Taking it back
Reviews.Author: dude man
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera so we don't have to bring our digital slr on vacation with us in a few weeks. I just couldn't get over the bad quality of the images. Overexposed and grainy. Didn't even test it in water. Ordered the Canon Powershot d10 instead.

Reviews.Title: Won't buy again
Reviews.Author: Brittany Aldape
Reviews.Content: Worked okay underwater in mexico for 2 trips snorkling. I followed the directions and rinsed and made sure the seal stayed clean and dry and then it just stopped working one day at the lake. Wasn't even using it underwater. It is very slow and take a long time to take the picture. The picture quality is pretty poor. I won't buy Olympus again.

Reviews.Title: Tough camera
Reviews.Author: Bowtie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because previously i had lost cameras due to drops, both on floors and/or in water.  This camera has proven very durable.  The camera has a slow response in low light situations, other than that it meets all my needs.

Reviews.Title: 3 years and still going strong
Reviews.Author: C. A. Snow
Reviews.Content: I bought this thing to use in diving and as a pocket camera when traveling.  Although it leaves a little to be desired, you can still take great pictures as long as you're just viewing them on a computer screen.Very durable and rugged.  I've dropped it, drowned it, and generally neglected it and it still looks good and works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: NOT shockproof
Reviews.Author: avidreader
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a while, though it is now destined for the trash heap. It has  been OK in taking medium-quality point-and-click shots similar to what one gets with a smartphone (a little better). The menus are not that straightforward, which means I usually just defaulted to the simplest because it took too long to figure out what the different options were (sometimes trying to make things idiot-proof by using pictures instead of words backfires). The waterproof aspect has always worked for me. I never took it deeper than 10 feet (maybe 5) and it never leaked.However, the reason it is destined for the trashheap is that the shockproofness is not as advertised. This fell from the height of my hip, so well under the supposed 5 feet (no, I am not ten feet tall), and half the distance was through water, which should slow the fall and thus minimize the impact, ultimately landing on rock under water. The camera completely shattered internally (the viewscreen inside the outermost piece of glass looks like a spiderweb of cracks), and I can not see anything in it anymore. The metal lens cover stopped retracting, though I eventually poked and prodded that enough to get it to work again, but I still can't see anything on the screen. FWIW, it still takes pictures and they come out fine; it's just that you don't know what you're taking a picture of. Point it in the general direction of your subject, and maybe you'll get a picture of what you want. And, of course, you can't see any of the menus, so changing any settings is a no-go.Time to research a newer and better option for tough point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: mjg2
Reviews.Content: the image quality was exceptionally low for 10mp.  eventually it stopped turning on, and they refused to warranty it.  i'll never buy another olympus product!

Reviews.Title: I got totally duped by Olympus marketing
Reviews.Author: oops
Reviews.Content: None of the features panned out the way I expected.WATER USE:Yes, it's waterproof, but it doesn't help if it takes terrible underwater pictures. Even if you could maneuver the non-user friendly settings/options, there is no way you can get the lighting and speed right. All my pix came out blurry or discolored. I would have been better off with a disposable camera.LAND USE:I liked the idea of having a drop-proof sturdy camera, but unfortunately it could not take decent land pictures :( They were pretty low quality...smartphones take better pix than this.

Reviews.Title: dont buy for water use
Reviews.Author: sara m
Reviews.Content: Dont buy this camera if you plan on using it under water.  I used it 3 or 4 times then it let in water.  I was told that you have to change the seal every year.  I paid $80 to olympus to repair and they send me some spare seals. Seems you have to take to a distributer to get the seal change!! $28 plus shipping, not worth the maintance costs, buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera, terrible company
Reviews.Author: Megan R
Reviews.Content: We bought the Stylus Tough 6020 less than 2 years ago after a customer service rep swore up & down that it was the "toughest" camera out there---waterproof and, given that we had 2 boys (ages 2 yrs. & 4 months at the time), tough enough to withstand just about anything short of being run over by a Mack truck...several times.  The reason we were on the phone with Olympus in the first place is to get them to replace one of their cameras that had crapped out on my brother, a US Marine, for no reason; at that time, he had just deployed to Afghanistan & his camera just died & he had little contact with the outside world.  Olympus fixed his problem by agreeing after a LOT of arguing from me that since he's risking his life for our country, the least they could do is send him a camera that actually works for more than 2 seconds. This rep then convinced us to buy the same camera (we did think about it for a while before making an impulse buy) because hey, if it can withstand fighting conditions in Afghanistan, surely it could survive our suburban lifestyle, right?  WRONG.  In July, after VERY LITTLE water use (hey, we live in Boston...how much beach time do we really see?), our camera just didn't turn on.  Upon inspection, the battery compartment looked corroded, so I made a special trip to a UPS store and spent $15 to ship it back to diagnose---oh, and this is after waiting hours for the supposedly easy, user-friendly email paperwork that you fill out online & are supposed to then get an email to print out & include in your shipment.  Yeah, 3 weeks later & I still never got that email (and no, it's NOT in my spam.)  I was supposed to get a response from Olympus once they received the camera within 24 hours.  3 days later, no response, so I finally just called and spoke to "Stacy" (who, by the way, was the only person who answered the phone every time I called...I was trying, after call #1, to get a more polite rep on the phone.)  She proceeded to tell me that my camera needed major repairs & I would owe $125 to fix it.  Are you kidding me?  For that, I could have 2 or 3 new, more reliable digital cameras from a better company!  So I explained why I felt it wasn't right that they were charging me for a camera that was literally called "TOUGH" & was supposed to withstand virtually anything (much more than being dropped a few times by us or taking some pics on vacation while underwater in the pool or ocean).  Rather than abiding by the old theory that the customer is always right, she blamed US for not washing it after each water use (which was wrong, because my husband informed me that he followed the directions to a "T" and washed it after each use thoroughly) and told me that we should have read the manual.  She had no sympathy whatsoever and even when I suggested that I wanted to talk to a manager, she blew me off.  My only options were to fix it or have it sent back & A) be out of a camera that I spent at least $300 only 22 months ago and B) eat the $15 I spent to ship it.  So I told her to just send it back.  Needless to say, I will NEVER buy another Olympus product again as they do not stand behind their products and I will be sure to share my experiences with Olympus with everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Get it wet and you own a paper weight
Reviews.Author: Matthew B. Diehl
Reviews.Content: I've owned 2 of these Stylus-tough cameras.  Both failed on me at crucial moments (one snorkeling in the Bahamas, one swimming with the stingrays in Tahiti). Both are now paper-weights.  I read and followed all instructions to the letter, and take immaculate care of all my equipment. This was not a case of exceeding design specifications, this was product failure, pure and simple.It should also be noted that image quality (while the cameras functioned) was fair at best. This was a trade-off for the toughness this camera was supposed to have. Not to mention the shameful way Olympus uses it's proprietary Xd storage cards so you have to buy special memory (Everyone else uses Sd cards).I decided to purchase a budget point and shooter and a dive case;http://www.amazon.com/Polaroid-Dive-Rated-Waterproof-Camera-Housing/dp/B004FS2DB2/ref=pd_cp_p_2Hopefully that will work better. These cameras are not tough, they are made to last only as long as the waranty. I highly recommend avoiding this product.

Reviews.Title: Great TOUGH camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest camera that I have ever had! I do climbing, canyoneering and caving all of which destroy cameras. This camera has been dropped 20', hit a rock and bounced about 5' then hit another rock and landed on a rock bed. The only thing that happened was it was scratched and had one dent. Then I dropped it into a hole in a cave and it was two weeks before we could come back and retrieve it. The cave conditions were very hot, dusty, dirty and hostile. The camera worked excellently when we pulled it out of the hole that it had been in. In fact the touch functions had activated and the camera was taking pictures of us while we were trying to get it out of the hole. This camera has been beat up, banged up, scraped and dropped and it still works perfectly. No complaints on this at all.Love this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor and underwater camera!!
Reviews.Author: Erin R.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I bought it more for the outdoors and to mess around with my photography "skills" and it is great. Not so great indoors, pictures tend to come out kind of grainy unless you are using the macro feature. Underwater it is AMAZING! Even the sound quality is good! I have used it underwater in a pool and a lake and the pictures and video are really clear and crisp! I would recommend this camera for the avid outdoor-person who cant spend a lot of money on a decent camera. The soom after you take the picture is great as well. Great value for the price and functions of the camera!!

Reviews.Title: It's on okay camera but it really isn't "tough"
Reviews.Author: Pickles
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift last May right before I went to the beach. While the waterproof, freezeproof and shockproof aspects of the camera have worked just fine, I'm disappointed that the exterior was not build to withstand abrasions. Specifically, the plastic covering the LCD screen got destroyed while I was hiking and I put the camera in my pocket...there was no debris, sand, dirt, or pebbles in there. Unfortunately, Olympus doesn't consider this normal wear and tear and even states that any dirt, etc. that affects the outerlayer is outside of their warranty policy. That's pathetic considering this camera is suppose to be "tough".So...PROS: It's a decent camera for someone on the go.CONS: The camera fails to undertake minor "scrapes and bruises"

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: ELS
Reviews.Content: Though this camera has generally been ok, it is not waterproof.  The original died by drowning (in salt water), got a replacement and the second one also died by drowning (also in salt water--less than 10 feet).  Will look at other brands.

Reviews.Title: Disatisfied
Reviews.Author: She she
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for my husband as a gift for our unforgettable vacation to Hawaii, opened the box the night before we were due to leave and noticed a few items missing in the box, we were not able to take the camera with us, wrote to the owner, but no answer to a resolution. We were able to locate a charger for the camera, but after a few shots, the shutter will not open to allow us to take pictures with the camera, so the camera is no use to us. I have been a customer with Amazon for years and this is the first time I have purchased an item that is defective and can not use.  Very unhappy customer. Shelia

Reviews.Title: Good All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: cdallman
Reviews.Content: This is my third Olympus underwater camera. They take good picture. They are easy to use. Just be aware that the life expectancy for this camera is about 2 years. But for the price...I just buy any new one.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: I have had now two Olympus Stylus Tough digital cameras. My first one lasted a little over three years and was one of the best purchases I had ever made--it lasted through college shenanigans, trips to the beach, being put in cups of beer and the pool, being thrown around and dropped several times. I never once had any issues with this camera until I took it to the OBX and brought it in the ocean. I was in about waist deep water with large waves crashing on the camera and myself--sure enough when I got out of the ocean the camera had white spots all over the screen and would no longer work. I attributed this malfunction to the years of abuse this camera had been through and thought nothing of it. So when this one died I upgraded to the Stylus Tough 6000---COMPLETE DISAPPOINTMENT. I took care of this camera and took all proper precautions that I had not taken with my previous camera. Not even a year after getting the camera I went on a float down the James River and maybe had it submerged in waist deep water for 10 minutes. Now the camera says "Card cover open" and will not move past this screen. There was also extensive water damage to the inside of the camera that was apparent to anyone who looked at the lens. This being the second Olympus camera I have had that was "waterproof" that died because of "water damage" I will not purchase an Olympus camera again. I would definitely consider looking at other options before purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked great and then quit on me
Reviews.Author: VSignore5
Reviews.Content: The camera was excellent until after one week of having it, it died. Brought it on vacation where I used it at the jersey shore. Worked perfect but started to notice water somehow getting in where the battery was, I followed the instructions and cleaned it after every use. Finally on the last day the screen was unusable due to water inside it. It is suppose to be leak free and sealed shut but it wasnt.

Reviews.Title: Good for underwater shots and videos - not good for general purpose amateur use
Reviews.Author: Albert Krespin
Reviews.Content: Quick and easy camera if you are after capturing fun pictures underwater. I originally purchased this for a winter snowboarding holiday. It is durable, survived many serious drops etc. In summer time, when you use underwater sometimes the inner lens cover wall gets fogged and you need to dry the camera under the sun to get rid of the fog.Very slow in starting up. Very slow between shoots - you occasionally miss photo opts. Video mode start up time is particularly slow.The image equality is not so good. You understand better when you compare two same shots (not underwater of course) one with Olympus other with another camera (I have a Canon SX10) - Olympus output is considerably poorer.Underwater image quality is OK and acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 6000 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD (Yellow)
Reviews.Author: pedro
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus 6000 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD (Yellow)  excellent all-terrain camera holds 10 meters under water very good I've dropped several times and I have not been damaged

Reviews.Title: Will miss you Olympus
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have ever had.  Takes crystal clear pictures and videos underwater.  Unfortunately the string attached to the wrist strap was not as durable as the camera itself and now our wonderful camera is at the bottom of the Caribbean Sea.  We will definitely be buying another one and will reinforce the string the next time we are in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: Not So Waterproof
Reviews.Author: kross
Reviews.Content: I had problems with mine both times I hit the salt water with it.  Now they want me to pay $118 to repair it.  I'm really dissatisfied with this not-so-waterproof "waterproof" camera.

Reviews.Title: Why 3 stars?
Reviews.Author: S. A. S "S. A. S"
Reviews.Content: Well, this is a good camera.  Bought it for my daughter.  It does not have the functionality to be charged while hooked to the computer.  The battery has to be removed and placed in the charger.  I think the 14MP version (Tough 8010) is a superior buy.  Bought one for my wife from Beach camera+an extra battery+16GB card+tripod+cleaner+case+lens protector+USB reade+floating strap for $185** , last I checked the price it was 275, they must have had a promotion.[...]

Reviews.Title: great for underwater
Reviews.Author: twin mom 2
Reviews.Content: We have an older model of this same camera. We bought it for my parents and showed them how to use it on a snorkling trip in Maui. Great photos and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: a complete disappointment
Reviews.Author: s
Reviews.Content: I used to love olympus, but this one takes the cake for being a worthless digital camera.  It died in a few months with gentle, mostly indoor use.  Lens sticks, so it beeps a few times and shuts down. Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Rugged Camera
Reviews.Author: Clayton Smith

Just thought I'd share what you can expect after a year of use.

Reviews.Title: Starts out great, goes downhill.
Reviews.Author: effy12
Reviews.Content: I got this camera  two years ago, and it started out fantastic. Picture quality was fantastic. Waterproof, drop proof, freeze proof. It was great. Over the years, though, the picture quality has decreased dramatically. The pictures are not clear, they are very pixel-y. I paid $250 for this camera when I bought it, so I would have hoped it would have lasted for more than two years.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera In Or Out of Water
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Simply I am very happy with the camera. I use it as my main camera now over my Cannon 20D SLR because it goes anywhere and it's tough enough to let the kids use it with out fear of dropping it or getting it wet. It takes very good photos in and out of water unlike some water proof cameras. Just make sure you don't dive with it and make sure the seals on the covers are clean and with out sand or so forth. I've had mine over a year and I still love it. Negative the sound quality is pretty bad on the video but other then that it's a good all around go any where camera. Love it.

Reviews.Title: DIED UNDERWATER
Reviews.Author: GinaBina
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of years and it has been fine for most applications. However, the first time I tried to use it underwater (snorkeling in the Caymans) it died. It took maybe 3 pictures and now it won't work at all. I talked to a professional photographer who told me that any camera waterproof to only 10 ft is not going to have a good enough feel for any underwater application (I was only 2-3 feet below the surface). I do not recommend this camera for underwater use.After talking with Olympus customer service, I will never buy another Olympus product again. WHen I told them of my experience, they said that the seals on the camera need to be replaced once a year in order to ensure waterproofing. But where does it say that? On page 65 in tiny print. I told them that that seemed like rather an important point and why wasn't it more prominently displayed? This is just a warning for anyone looking at "underwater" cameras... beware of the fine print!

Reviews.Title: Looks like a shining crown jewel... functions like Imodium.
Reviews.Author: beaker
Reviews.Content: When the reviewers talk about slow shutter lag speed... LISTEN UP! I didn't. This camera is irrevocably and fatally flawed by its tortuously slow shutter lag. In bright light it occasionally works OK and takes fairly decent pictures. But, in low light settings the lag time is up to 8 SECONDS! EIGHT SECONDS!! (That's called the 'self-timer' feature on any other camera!) Heck, I was trying to photograph my granddaughter playing on the beach in Hawaii in broad daylight and it missed every single shot! How Olympus EVER had the gall to release this into the market place is beyond me. The camera does all kinds of other nifty but worthless tricks, but the shutter lag makes it virtually USELESS as a camera. This is not a camera; it's a sophisticated and expensive waste of natural resources. And a complete waste of time and energy. We have a $50 Kodak easy share that will out-perform this pretty little door stop hands down. Olympus should recall this model and rebate every penny to their customers who unwittingly purchased it. Move on to ANY other camera and don't give this thing a second thought. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: Great all weather camera
Reviews.Author: eodgator
Reviews.Content: I've used the camera in field conditions from -20 C to driving rain and it just works.  It obviously doesn't have the best optics nor will it take the best quality pictures but it will take pictures where few cameras can.  I carry it in rough terrain, drop it and still it works.  The only improvement that I would like to see is to be able to take photos faster.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Everything!
Reviews.Author: lynxsta
Reviews.Content: I use this at the beach, in (and out of) the ski boat, in the snow ... EVERYWHERE! It's a great camera, takes excellent pictures and videos, and it's small enough to fit in my jacket pocket or my husband's shorts pockets. I have a Canon Digital Rebel SLR that I used to take everywhere (carefully) but now it never comes out unless we're doing portrait shots or safe sight seeing. My Olympus is a permanent pack-to-go item!My brother had the same camera and it filled with water ... because he neglected to properly close one of the two openings. Always check the compartments before throwing the camera in the water! With the ocean and sand combination, sometimes the shutter will "stick". Just dunk the camera in the water and turn it off and on a couple of times to open and close the shutter. Cleans it out nicely.My camera came with a "life jacket" which works great. It's bright orange so it's visible from a distance on the water or the snow ... and it floats.OLYMPUS 202353 Float Case (Orange)

Reviews.Title: another untough camera
Reviews.Author: Kristen Weaver "graphics kid"
Reviews.Content: This is, or should I say WAS my 2nd Olympus tough camera. (I lost the 1st snowboarding) This camera did not have nearly the photo quality of the first (the stylus 1030sw) and the gasket became corroded and leaked after a few months of use, even with proper rinsing and cleaning of the camera. The photos taken in low light are very poor and grainy as well.

Reviews.Title: don't waste your time or energy
Reviews.Author: pissed to hell
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christmas present and it didn't even last a month before I had to send it back for repairs.  It sucks at night and takes terrible pictures in low light.  Within the first vacation the screen stopped working, then the panoramic function stopped working... I sent it in for repairs- and within the next couple of months I had to send it back for more issues.  I then sent it back because the camera wasn't registering the memory card.  They found no problems... the problem persisted... I sent it back- they said it was a memory card issue... I bought a new memory card and the problem still persists.  The customer service sucks!  They are giving me the run around- and now after 4 repairs they are refusing to acknowledge its a lemon and instead of replacing it, I have to send it in for repairs- AGAIN!  I have a huge vacation coming up, that should have breathtaking views- but I can't use my camera because its going to be in the shop for repairs- AGAIN!  Are you kidding me?!?!?

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but very slow
Reviews.Author: busy mom five
Reviews.Content: We really like the size and portability of this camera, and love that the kids can take pictures without me worrying about them breaking it.  The picture quality seems pretty good too, and it has some very fun features to play with.  It is also very easy to load the pictures to the computer and the editing program is pretty easy to figure out.  HOWEVER . . . this camer is SUPER slow.  I find that by the time the picture is taken, the kid is already all the way across the room.  Not a good camera for action shots.  We will be keeping it, just because it is so portable and durable.  But if I had it to do over, I would choose a camera with more focus on picture speed and quality and less focus on the durability.

Reviews.Title: Another Solid Oly
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Owned an Oly that my wife has taken control so there was only one action to take....get my own!  I have owned Olympus cameras for 30+ years and they are solid performers.

Reviews.Title: it's ok
Reviews.Author: Boots
Reviews.Content: I got this because I have a bad tendency of dropping my cameras - well it does hold up to its promise - it won't break when dropped -  but it takes grainy pictures with a 30 second delay that is annoying, especially if you are trying to capture something quickly. I took it snorkeling with me and the lens locked up and wouldn't close. It wouldn't let me take pictures and I couldn't figure out what was wrong with it while treading water in the middle of the ocean. I had to let it dry out and eventually it started working again - but I missed many photo ops - I probably would have missed them anyway though because of the delay.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: green owl
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera;however, the battery did not  last that long at the beginning, but after a couple of usage it did not get discharged. I guess the more you use it the better the life of the battery. It takes some awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: I BREAK EVERYTHING!
Reviews.Author: Amanda K. Stroder "AK's"
Reviews.Content: I am not good with electronics, I either break it or lose it. But this camera is AWE$OME! i kept paying $100 here, $100 there when my screen would break on my old cameras. I as well as my friends and family have dropped this camera numerous times and is still in tact. The picture quality is great. I love the beauty mode, and the tap feature. I have nothing bad to say about this camera, i am very satisfied with it.Great purchase. This camera is a TOUGH camera for sure.

Reviews.Title: tough camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Miller "master of tools"
Reviews.Content: very tough, i carry around with me all the time, shows minimal wear considering what i have dealt it. image quality isnt fantastic but with durability in mind its still a great buy

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Y. Jerena "SHOPAHOLIC"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a trip to Jamiaca and Grand Cayman. I LOVED IT. I took it to Dunns River waterfall and not only did it make threw all the water but it took amazing pictures indoor and out. it also has really great video. It took me a long time to decued which camera to buy and I am very happy I choose this one. i droped it in the waterfall, on the ground, and had it in the sand and it worked great. THe picture quality is amazing under water, out doors, inside, and even in a dark club. it has lots of good features and at a very good price. Its the best money i've spent I LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worried about bad reviews of this camera?
Reviews.Author: Diego Betancur
Reviews.Content: Hi,I bought the camera a couple of weeks ago, and before i got it delivered i read the reviews, then i started to worry about my purchase. The average score of the camera isn't that good and some people questioned its main features.Well, I have to say I've taken my camera to the test, and it worked very well, more than i thought. But that's because after i read all the reviews my expectatives got low. It works very good underwater, and i recomend this camera.Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Great Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: n/a "Susan M"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I had it for two years before I lost it.  It worked perfectly and travelled with me around the world.  I think it's more water-resistant than waterproof.  I was having too much fun in the water and had it submerged for over an hour and it got some moisture inside of it and wouldn't work until I dried it out, but once I didn't it worked perfectly again.  It is very durable, as I've taken it cliff jumping into the water off a 50ft cliff.  I dropped in many of times and have taken into every body of water imaginable (oceans, lakes, springs, and puddles).  So sad that I lost it and now have to replace it and now I'm probably going to upgrade to the new 6020, hopefully that one will be just as good as this one.

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: D. Kunitomi
Reviews.Content: price was good, improvement over 720 which I used for two years -- better features, and overall picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Ok photos
Reviews.Author: Auburn Designer
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read reviews before buying this camera. It looked perfect for a trip where I would be outdoors hiking, as it was small and compact. I also liked that it could be used in water, since we have a pool and live at the beach. So far, the underwater function has worked fine for us and the camera takes beautiful photos outdoors in bright light. The camera did stop working when my husband had it on a trip to wintery Denmark (-4 degrees). However, the big disappointment with this camera is that it takes absolutely dismal indoor photos. I cannot seem to find a setting that will work for indoor action, birthday parties, etc. So, this camera is going to be the beach and pool camera and now I need to find something that works better indoors!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Graceful Raven "Ben"
Reviews.Content: This is the First Digital Camera I've owned and recieved it as a Christmas Gift.  This is diffenently a very good camera to start with as far as learning is concerned.  Learning since this is my first digital camera, while reading the instructions and getting to know photography a little more.The features on the Camera are suffecient and the menu is easy to operate.  It is also compatable with a 8 gb Micro SDHC in using the adapter.  Though I've only just begun to test the camera, I have many plans on using it on my trip to Alaska in the Summer.  With 8 gb, I'll be taking more pictures of Alaska then ever and soon my online Albums will be filled with higer quality pictures.A starters Camera to learn from, for me, yes.  Even for educated users its a great camera.This Camera has many features including Panoramic pictures.But the only thing I see is missing, is the Black & White feature.So if you can afford it, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Andrea Schaefer
Reviews.Content: I am very active in the warmer months, and was looking for a camera that I can take anywhere and not worry about dropping it, or it getting rained on, or getting wet by a pool, or even bouncing around on an ATV. I bought this camera after doing a lot of research, and knowing what the reviews were.The picture quality with this camera is beautiful. Some are saying that the photos are grainy, and yes, they are when you use it on out of the box settings. It happened to me and I was very discouraged, but I played around with it, and now the quality is amazing! I set my image quality compression on 'fine', and that solved the problem.The camera comes with specific instructions on underwater usage. I have not tried it yet, but the instructions are very simple and easy to remember. The key is to keep the lens clean at all times, and to thoroughly clean the camera and lens after outings. This can be done by running the lens, open, under a stream of water, and submerging the entire camera for about 10 minutes. If you clean the lens without water, only use a lint free cloth, or lens pen.Since this camera is freeze proof (to 14F), I took it out on a lake with me today and took a lot of pictures. I gave the camera a good workout, and it did a great job. It didn't freeze up or stall at all. The temperature outside was around 25F. I also took a picture of a fish that was swimming by a FishTV underwater camera, and the Olympus captured the fish perfectly.The package included with the camera has the Olympus Master 2, which is the editing program for your pictures. This program has a ton of different things you can do to your photos. I had a Kodak before this, and it's editing program was no where near as large as the Master 2.Yes, this camera does have slow shutter speed. That bothered me at first, but after seeing what this camera can really do, I'll take the slow shutter speed. It does take about 4 seconds after pressing the button to take the photo.All in all, I definitely recommend this camera. If you take the time to play around with it and learn the features, I think you'll be very happy.

Reviews.Title: Divided opinions...
Reviews.Author: Juan P. Gonzalez "100% Chapín..."
Reviews.Content: Its size and weight are OK, but its ease of use hmmm... I'm not fully convinced about it.  Lately a lot of these "point and shoot" digital cameras limit the way you can play around with options like "shutter speed, exposure, etc".  Simply, with this camera you can't set these settings; either you stick with the iAuto option or try to get "the best from it" using the SCN option... but none of them really work. Apparently Olympus thought the camera might know better what kind of picture you want to take better than you do.People might say "get yourself a SLR"... but no, it's not necessary to buy one of those cameras. Four yeas ago I bought a Canon PowerShot and it was the best digital camera I've ever used. Why didn't I got a similar one this time? Well, I have to admit my wife wanted a waterproof camera... and she got in love with this one.  She loves the camera, I don't...If you want a basic and "intelligent" point and shoot camera... get this one, it's also shockproof... but if you want freedome while operating your camera, look somewhere else... give it a try with the Canon PowerShot.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: J. M. Kolesar "tennis1"
Reviews.Content: I have only had a chance to take indoor pictures so far in a gym which is always tough.  I wasnt totally impressed with the picture quality but I am still experimenting with different settings.  Can't wait to use it on vacation.  Need more time to make a good review.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: L. Ray "Extreme Sports Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical about buying a refurbished camera, but I am very happy with its performance so far!  It has certainly proven its freeze-proof and waterproof capabilities because I took it out in the snow for a couple hours.  I actually dropped it in the snow when I was sledding and couldn't find it for about 10 minutes, so it was exposed to the cold and moisture for a while.  When I found it, the power was still on and it worked just fine!  I can't wait to take it to the beach during spring break and try it out underwater when I go snorkeling.  What a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas from my boyfriend and I love it.  I have two small kids so it's auto stablizing feature is wonderful and the quality looks like a still shot.  It is small and "tough" just like it says, I take it everywhere with me.  I've owned a cannon and a GE in the past and this surpasses them by miles.  Never used it underwater, but I definately recommend this camera for anyone with kids or without kids for that matter.  Only other thing is that you have to get at least a 4GB memory card if you plan to use the finest quality setting because the .jpeg file size is very large.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy Camera
Reviews.Author: Sue M. "Sue"
Reviews.Content: This is hands down one of the best camera's for the active lifestyle.  Practically, unbreakable if accidently dropped.  Can even be used under water and takes great quality pictures, unlike those poor quality shots from the underwater disposible camers.  There are so many features in this camera, you'll have a blast learning and using all of them.  Well worth every penny spent on it.

Reviews.Title: Love the Olympus Stylus Tough-6000 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Florida Grandma
Reviews.Content: Gave the camera to my daughter-in-law for Christmas.  She was thrilled and couldn't wait to start using it.  Tested it that day in the pool and it worked perfect underwater!

Reviews.Title: Just what i wanted
Reviews.Author: Ron A. Hoffpauir
Reviews.Content: The Camera came in on time as they said, and was in perfect condition when it arrived. I absolutely adore this camera. Me being a swimmer i am able to bring it around the pool and not be worried. It takes wonderful underwater pictures, just remember to put it on the underwater settings when you do and put it back to normal when out of the water. This camera is something you can take where ever you go, if you are looking for a compact camera i recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...if only it were waterproof, it would be great!
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Sion Adissi
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera and was very happy with the picture quality and camera functions. The smile capture function makes good laughs with friends....However the camera did not last more than 5 min in the water. It completely stopped to work and got me very frustrated.Amazon was very nice, offered a replacement at no cost, but I simply cannot trust the brand anymore.I'll take my money back.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Dolly
Reviews.Content: It's an excellente product, I'm happy for have a product of high quality. In cameras is the best.

Reviews.Title: Make sure the water is clean and clear
Reviews.Author: HaroldusMagnus
Reviews.Content: Got this "tough" camera for my son as a Christmas present.  He body / board surfs, swims and dives.  First use was to go to Sandy Beach in Oahu.  Well, in surf conditions, lots of sand is kicked up.  That sand finds its way into the lens shield and apparently many other places.  While it looked spotless, once dunked into a bucket of fresh water and shaken, at least a teaspoon of sand came out of it.  It was hiding in all the cracks and spaces.  Needless to say, there is no way to get it all out and it jams the lens shield.  The camera tries to turn on - meaning the electronics were protected, but the mechanical buttons and lens shield were jammed shut by sand still trapped (no amount of shaking will dislodge it.)  So camera immediately turns off.  If you are not using in pristine, super clear water, don't use this camera unless you like the idea of a $200 single use experience.  Do not take it surfing!!  Oh, and the delay between pressing the button to take a shot and the shot firing is very long.  Nothing has changed on that front with Olympus.  Had a point and shoot from them several years ago - wish I had remembered that aspect of their performance.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: P. Dinwoodie
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent. The functions are fairly easy to use . The camera definitely is waterproof as advertised and seems pretty durable. I use it for hardcore fishing adventures, and it has held up to some serious abuse so far. Looking forward to testing it in the cold weather for ice fishing, but I have no doubt it will preform well.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cal
Reviews.Content: I've bought it for de porability and durability and the quality of the photos surprised me. It's just awesome!! Such a small and portable camera, such an image quality!!. I remcomend it 100%.La compré por lo portable y durable y la calidad de las fotos me sorprendió. Son increibles!!  Es pequeña y durable y la imagen de las fotos es impresionante!!. La recomiendo en un 100%

Reviews.Title: Excellent Photos
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M. Mc Nabb "Kathleen"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for our most recent trip to Hawaii. We snorkel a lot and also rented motorcycles. This camera took some great underwater photos and some not so great. As with a regular camera have to chose the light and settings. The ability of the camera to take panoramic shots is one of the features we liked the most. Most important about taking panoramic views is to make sure that you don't change the angle of the camera when taking the photos that the camera will automatically stictch together.  AND I also dropped the camera and it did justfine.

Reviews.Title: Great performance on my rafting trip...
Reviews.Author: ollie
Reviews.Content: While I really wanted to bring my Canon 40D on my rafting trip down the Grand Canyon...I knew that the wet, dirt and sand would not be a good thing for my expensive DSLR setup. I got the Olympus Tough 6000 as a gift just before we left...charged the battery the night before and off we went.The standard battery allowed me to take just over 350 pictures (set at 2 meg, not the full 10 meg to conserve space on my 1 Gig card) and took 22 videos of about 20-40 seconds each on that one battery charge. I was mindful of not leaving the camera on when not shooting, and reviewed the pictures/videos only a couple of times to conserve power...The camera did stand up well to sand, dust and water (lots of splashes while hitting the white water during the rafting, but I did not test more than a foot or so underwater so i can't comment on that.) I got some great shots of the waves coming over me and some cool effects with water droplets on the lens.Overall, the camera was great...a few little quirks when the camera decided to not respond. Had to remove the battery for a second then it was fine again. Took better than expected pictures...but it is obviously not a DSLR...as long as your expectations are to have a great little, easy to use camera that you can take to the beach, snow, pool, etc and get some good shots without worrying about ruining it...this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: What I was hoping for but does have some flaws
Reviews.Author: J. Ingram "Venturer6194"
Reviews.Content: I bought it for a snorkeling trip to the Flordia Keys, and it performed perfectly. However, the second a sea turtle swims right past me and I go to turn it on it just blinked at me. So after I got back on the boat I took the battery out and put it back in and it turned on, but besides that the camera stood by its waterproof rating. I did find that water droplets formed on the lenses quite often though, but they were easy enough to just blow out of the way. As far as the picture quality goes though I wasn't blown away. Pictures outside come out great, but low lighting shots defiantly suffered. Overall the 800 pictures I took on vacation (at least 200 were underwater) made this camera worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: Every thing I expected and then some
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I wanted a camera that I didn't have to worry about while playing outside.  I have had it in the dirt, taken pictures underwater in a river and in a pool and it worked perfectly and the pictures came out great, even better than expected.  I haven't dropped it yet, I just can't bring myself to test this feature.  It is very compact easy to put in your pocket for easy access. Some of the reviews I had read said the pictures weren't great but I haven't seen one poor quality picture come out yet. The menus are easy to navigate and to understand, I had the the menu/button layout figured out with the first couple of shots.  Only knock is I can't figure out how to make the digit zoom stay on, it resets every time I power down.  I am sure I am just missing something. I LOVE THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Great for the outdoors!
Reviews.Author: Chad E. Davis "Chadpole"
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this camera were back and forth but I felt the good out weighed the bad so I purchased the camera. I purchased it initially for a rafting event. I was very pleased with how well the camera operated while going down river. The camera got plenty wet and I took close to 200 pics with it and not one problem. The pictures turned out great and no leaks what so ever which I saw reported in previous reviews. The battery life was decent but I purchased an extra battery to be on the safe side. I do not recommend this camera for long distance shots. The zoom isn't what I would prefer but the ability to get the camera wet and be a little rough with it more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: Performs as advertised!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Woodall
Reviews.Content: Great camera....great price.  I was weiry of using underwater do to previous reviews, but I did and wow am I ever happy.  Great pics and have had no problems thus far.  Good price for all the features!! Especially love the tap feature. Would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Young "Jenny"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my bulky digital one that used diskettes.  I LOVE this camera!!!  It has a lot of features, some of which I'll probably never even use.  The features are easy to figure out with a little help from the manual.  (The panoramic feature is nice!)I'd like to address some of the cons I've read in other reviews:Regarding the review that said the camera had just stopped working...  I was afraid that's what had happened with me also when it stopped working right in the middle of trying to take a picture.  I tried replacing the battery (I always carry a spare), and it was working again.  (I never noticed the low battery indicator light come on.)Regarding the review that said there's horrible streaking if you point it anywhere near the sun....  Yes, you can see streaking - but only on the display screen, not on the photo itself.Regarding the review that said he/she couldn't get a good inside shot even after changing the settings - I have had no issues with getting good inside shots.  If an inside shot comes out a bit too dark, it can easily be touched up with the Olympus Master software.Regarding the review that said it doesn't take good shots of anything that isn't still.  I've had SOME problem with this - but sometimes putting the camera on the sports setting fixes this (unless there's too much fast motion).Regarding the review that said night scenes come out blurry...  Yes, they do, if you don't put the camera on a tripod or hold it perfectly still on a hard surface.  I've gotten a few SPECTACULAR night shots when I've been able to rest the camera on something to hold it still!  (One of those shots was even a purposely blurred motion one for a lighted ride at an amusement park.  The blurred light effect came out just like I wanted, and everything else around it came out perfectly clear.)Regarding the reviews that say it takes about 3 seconds for it to snap a picture once you press the shutter button...that's an exaggeration.  I timed it, and it's definitely less than 3 seconds.  It does take longer than I'd like to focus in some situations, though.Regarding the review that said it locked up on her 3-7 times a day when out snorkeling.  I've had this happen to me only a couple times since buying the camera almost 3 years ago.  (I've had to pop the battery out & pop it back in to get it working again.)  I think this is a very minor con, considering how long I've had this camera.Regarding the reviews that say the picture quality is poor & the photos come out grainy....  I don't know if maybe they're not using the camera on the right settings for the situations, because the only time I have this problem is when I'm taking pictures at an indoor show with only the stage lighting & a lot of movement on the stage.  (I think I may have finally found something that works for that though - will be able to test my theory in June.)  Other than that, I find the picture quality to be awesome!!  If I'm not quite happy with the tone or contrast, this can easily be fixed with the Olympus Master software.I can't comment on the reviews regarding the camera not working after using it in water, because I don't take any underwater photos.My only complaints about the camera are the slow start-up time when you turn it on, and not being able to zoom when recording a video.  I feel these are very minor complaints, considering how happy I am with the camera overall.  I would definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Allan H Pierce
Reviews.Content: We have experience with three people in the Peace Corps who owned this camera and all of the cameras failed. One was replaced three times before they managed to get one that worked. Look at the Olympus web site to see the limitations on using the camera underwater. We contacted Olympus and they stated that the camera must be returned to them yearly to have it resealed (at additional cost)even with an extended warranty. Canon and Pentax have better underwater digital cameras that don't have the shutter lag time, marginal picture quality, and poor customer service that comes with the Olympus.

Reviews.Title: This Camera only work for a three monts
Reviews.Author: Cumana43 "FranK"
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus Tough-6000 10 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)I buy this camera on Nov.01/2010 it was used by my doughter to take photos for her carrer on The University, but on January 22 the camera do not work any more,  because the contact between Body camera and Batery door has a rust.After we used the camera on the sea water it was cleaned with Fresh and natural water, as is indicate on the Owner manual.We claim this problem to the Seller but unfortunately they do not respond my email.We do not recomend this products as a waterproof, if you need a waterproof camera please buy other brand and use other seller.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Berman
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  It's tough and easy to use.  I no longer have blurry pictures!  :)

Reviews.Title: Average Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Darren G
Reviews.Content: I was not overly happy with this camera.  The first time I went to use the camera to take underwater photo's in the ocean, it wouldn't turn on. Sand had gotten in the camera where the lens cover is and it was jambed closed.  Once I dug out the miniscule piece of sand, it worked fine until another piece of sand caused it to happen again.The second issue I have with this camera is it's timing in turning on and taking photo's.  It is ridulous how long it takes. I read a review that said that you can speed this up by turning off the camera's picture review and getting a faster memory card.  I did that and it is still slow.One plus to the camera is that the picture quality was very good.  It doesn't compare to my DSLR but I like it for being a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: timmyflash18
Reviews.Content: I just ordered a camera that I needed in by Friday (today is Tuesday).  So I called the customer service to make sure it would make it in time.  They quickly informed me that it probably wouldn't make it, but they could ship it over night and I wouldn't have anything to worry about.Awesome customer service.

Reviews.Title: Shop around before you settle
Reviews.Author: RJR "RJR"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the claimed durability. I wanted a camera I could use on my motorcycle and should I get caught in the rain it wouldn't be a problem or the vibration wouldn't hurt it.Well, it has this touch feature that is supposed to allow you to take pictures w/ ease. The trouble, I cannot shut it off. I have it mounted on the motorcycle and it interprets the vibration of the road and engine as me requesting it to take a picture. Quite annoying. It does okay w/ video but will not zoom while you are shooting video.The shutter lag is also tough on a motorcycle as you are moving and want to get a picture when you want it, not 1.3 secs later (or whatever it takes).Has to be something better out there.Olympus' customer service is terrible. No responses to letters or e-mails and their call center people refer you to the retailer or the manual but they don't have a clue. Did you not think I had already read the manual?

Reviews.Title: It's OK, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: X. TANG
Reviews.Content: I owned Sony,Samsumg and Canon camera, I bought this camera for my elementary school daughter, she likes that. Picture quality is OK, but vedio quality is poor, especially the sound, which is barely to hear, so overall, I rate this camera as acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Great for a while then . . .
Reviews.Author: topher
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera two years ago and used it frequently.  Mostly for family shots and vacation photos.  I took it in the pool, the ocean and every body of water i could find.  I followed the instructions regarding the waterproof seals and never had a problem.  I recommended the camera to a friend and even bought a second one for my wife.  I loved the size and ease of shooting in and out of water.  The 10mp version I had was sufficient to blow up to 8 x 10 without an issue.  This past week my wife's camera (720SW)started giving us warnings about the seals and doors.  I guess that isn't surpriseing it was dropped hard on concrete and dinged up a bit.  So we decided not to put it into the water anymore.  The next day my camera had small water spots on the inside of the lens.  It still worked but had bubles in the lens.  I let it dry out and checked all the seals.  The next day I put it in the water and shot pics for 10 minutes before it blacked out and gave up.  When I opened the camera later there was water in the battery compartment and arounf the memory card.I got a good use out of the camera for nearly two years and I liked it alot.  Now I'm not sure if I want to try again or try to find another camera.

Reviews.Title: bad
Reviews.Author: Martin Gutierrez De Valle
Reviews.Content: Purchase the camera only for use in Costa Rica and take photos snorkeling, and the camera he entered the water, just take a picture within 1ft's, I hope the warranty change me.Solo compre la camara para hacer snorkel en Costa Rica y a la camara se le metio agua, espero que la garantia me la cambie, es la unica y primera vez que la use, duro solo una foto y la use solamente en la superficie.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ana Pellitero "Ing. Anilla"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is light weight and very easy tu use. It works perfectly underwater, in a pool or in the sea, it takes great pictures and great videos. I recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: Michigan Rifleman "ndjamena"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for our trip to the Galapagos Islands. We snorkeled every day for 10 days.  The camera was under water for close to 10 hours total.  Never a leak; never a problem! I now have some nice photos of sea turtles, sea lions, and numerous fish species.The camera does have some limitations. After taking a flash photo it does take 5 or 6 seconds to be ready for the next. The controls are a little difficult to use underwater. The zoom is only 3.6X.I am not a professional photographer, and the various reports on this camera state that the optics are NOT top notch. OK. But the image quality is fine for tourist photos.Considering the other reviews that state that the camera leaks one might conclude that Olympus has some quality control issues.  But my Olympus Tough has lived up to its name.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Walt Bagehot
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough camera, but it is NOT waterproof as claimed and -- worse -- Olympus won't stand behind the product.

Reviews.Title: very slow camera
Reviews.Author: MARIA ANGELICA DOS REIS GARRIDO PEREIRA
Reviews.Content: it's a good camera, the only problem is that it demands time to take the picture. It's nice that it's an aquatic camera.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof, Poor Quality Photos & Videos
Reviews.Author: Molanda M. Chiang "Mo"
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment.It's not waterproof.  I didn't even submerge the camera underwater; it only got slightly wet at the beach and after that, it alternated from not being able to be shut off (i had to take the battery out to shut the camera off) to constantly having the date menu pop up everytime the camera was turned on.Luckily this had occurred within 5 months of my purchasing the Olympus Tough 6000.  I was able to send the camera to the manufacturer to get it repaired.However, even with it working, it doesn't work very well.  It has the worst quality video I have ever seen.  And the photos are only a teeny bit better than that, but also the worst quality of any digital camera I have used.  I take photos and videos of rescue dogs needing foster homes for a rescue and 90% of the time am embarrassed of the quality of said pics and videos.This is the first time I am getting rid of a digital camera for its poor performance and replacing it with a better one.  I cannot believe Canon put out this product.

Reviews.Title: bad upgrade
Reviews.Author: PSF "PSF"
Reviews.Content: I have the previous olympus stylus without the tap control and it  is the best camera I own .I wanted a camera with more pixels that's about the only thing this one has had .The tap control continually resets your setting any thing less them bright light and you get no picture takes forever to snap a picture and you lose many of your pictures that you want to catch would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: olympus stylus tough-6000
Reviews.Author: samesince83
Reviews.Content: i wasn't very happy with this camera.  the functions on this camera were not as amazing as i had read.  they were harder to use and never achieved the picture quality that i was looking for.  the picture quality was nothing like the pictures in the advertisements.  i had this camera for less than 6 months and hadn't even used it that much when it broke.  my camera was securely closed when taken to a local water park, but when put under water the seal leaked allowing water to seep in ruining the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Non-Moving Objects
Reviews.Author: Skyangelc
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since its release.  The camera would be rated 5 stars if it wasn't for one major flaw: The delay is awful.  There's no using this camera at the following locations: Football games, soft ball games, bowling alleys, or any location where movement would be expected. I've constantly used the words, "I missed it" or "Hold still...sorry. Hold on." There's no catching special moments with this camera. Then again, maybe if your hobbies included watching paint dry, this camera just might catch it in action....MIGHT being the main word.

Reviews.Title: Saving my money to buy a Cannon.
Reviews.Author: W. Coleman "BOSXFN"
Reviews.Content: There is a problem with the battery connection, I lose date and time everytime I turn off the camera.The screen goes black everytime it is put in the water.It is a very slow start up and slow taking pictures even on the "sport" setting.I sent it twice for service and they clean it and return it with the same problem.I fixed the battery connection by putting a piece of cardboard in with the battery. As long as I keep it out of the water I can take pictures.We took the camera to St Thomas and when we were swimming there was a little fish that swam with us for about 20 minutes.  We don't have a picture because the camera was not working.  I climbed the highest peak in Virginia(it's not Everest but it's a big deal to me)and again no pictures.I am just saving up my money so I can go back and get another Cannon camera.

Reviews.Title: poor product
Reviews.Author: C. JORDAN "cj11363"
Reviews.Content: I too am disappointed in the quality of this camera.  Bought it because my Stylus 720 had served me well, but this camera is noticeably slower.  My biggest complaint is that the USB port failed within the warranty period, but apparently the USB port is not covered by the warranty.  Probably some fine print somewhere that I missed.  Probably my last Olympus camera.

Reviews.Title: hardened so you can throw it in frustration
Reviews.Author: Rich Gossweiler "Shiny!"
Reviews.Content: I think Olympus makes a hardened camera series so their cameras won't break when you throw them in frustration.Overall an expensive camera that will leave you with a cheap feeling and frustration trying to get it to take a nice picture in a timely manner. I strongly recommend the Panasonic Lumix DMC series over this.1) This camera takes almost *6* seconds to turn all the way on and be ready. Good luck with impromptu or action shots.2) This camera takes almost 2 seconds to take a picture and then return to ready.3) The user interface is absolutely horrible. On the back there is a "D-pad" which has left-right-up-down-ok. The don't seem to understand how it might be useful. In ready mode, clicking the up arrow hides the menu. Clicking it again undoes this. Clicking the left arrow brings up the menu. Clicking on it again does not undo this. Clicking the right arrow also brings up the menu as does clicking down arrow, the OK button and a dedicated "menu" button (in case you missed mashing one of the other 4). None of these take you to the start up menu, but rather to an awkward choose-a-shot-mode menu.4) The choose-a-shot-menu is off-by-one. You are actually adjusting the settings for the menu item to the left of the one in the column of settings (that is you are turning on/off flash for the menu over to the left by one). Huh?5) Don't worry though, until you find out how to get to the camera set up menu (none of the 6 hardware menue related buttons do this), it won't save your settings. You have to find this secret Easter-egg "Save Settings" option which defaults to OFF, and turn it on or you will lose your settings when you power off.  wow. That's what I want.6) It takes no less than 4 clicks to toggle flash on and off. In fact, every operation is buried under a bevy of clicks.7) The door that seals the battery and your flash card is difficult to open and close, making it easy to leave open and destroy the hardened aspect of this camera.8) Just the opposite, the power button is very easy to hit. So your camera will turn on and take pictures in your carrying case and pocket until the battery runs out.9) Image quality is poor in anything other than bright daylight. The harsh flash washes out the image. The flash comes on a lot where my other cameras don't need it.10) The casing is made of plastic (you can squeeze it to feel it bend) and feels very disposable plasticy.  Plastic is hard (luggage cases are made of this), but it feels cheap, rounding out the cheap feeling experience.I recommend the Panasonic Lumix DMC which has a slow power on too, but feels solid and takes great pictures and has a much better interface.

Reviews.Title: terrible camera in most lighting situations
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year. I've taken maybe 60 photos with it even though I'm an avid photographer. The picture quality is so bad I rarely bring it out. This camera will take good pictures in bright sunlight outdoors ONLY! I had to use it to take a picture of a hand yesterday and the flash kept coming on in iAUTO mode. Of the 3 pictures, 1 was blown out by the flash, 1 was out of focus, the the third was mediocre with poor detail. Most of the shots I've taken with it under less than ideal lighting (outdoors and bright sun) have come out inferior. All indoor shots are inferior. The software just isn't working here. It needs a lot more tuning, but Olympus has never updated the firmware.Another thing that's happened a lot is that the camera will randomly switch from using the data card to using the internal memory. So after a few shots it's full and I have to pull the card out and reinsert it to get it working again. I am using a 4GB Transcend microSD card with the XD card adapter supplied with the camera. I'm looking into buying a 2GB XD card now to see if that will fix the issue. I couldn't find any XD cards larger than 2GB. Very odd since I have a 16GB SD card in my other camera.The reason I got this camera in the first place was because I've drowned 2 others in the river fishing. So for showing that humongous fish you've caught, in which case capturing you and the fish is more important than the actual picture quality, this camera will suffice. It won't short out in the water and won't die when you drop it. But if you want pictures to print or post on Flickr, this is not it. My other camera is a Lumix LX3, my pride and joy. Comparing the 2 would be like comparing a Yugo with Lamborghini. Yugos were poorly designed and built cars from the 80s for you kids.

Reviews.Title: good and bad
Reviews.Author: Corn
Reviews.Content: The camera takes GREAT pictures in the water and out...very happy with it except the lense got stuck and it wouldn't take pictures until I cleaned it with a q-tip for hours and that's after reading and rereading the manual for 2 weeks trying to figure out what was wrong.

Reviews.Title: The Verdict is still out...............
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera for my daughter.  She wanted one like her sisters (850sw) which has been great in the water and elsewhere.  However.  I received the camera, charged the battery, and checked it over.  Read the directions. Gave it to my daughter who promptly took 140 pics on it in and out of the pool.  At the very end of the first night, she came to me saying it wasn't starting up.  I turned it on and it came right on without a problem. Then, the next day she said the same thing. I tried it and she was right. The little "olympus ditty" comes on with a finger pointing down onto the top of the camera on the screen then disappears, beeps about 5 times, then never turns on. I can download pics from it and the battery is charged. I have an email sent into Olympus but don't expect to hear from them any time real soon...I'll post an update if I can. BTW, it doesn't seem to have water in any of the compartments........

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Lynda M. Agosta "Martino Agosta"
Reviews.Content: Been looking for a waterproof camera for a while. This is the right choice i made..

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: A. Garman
Reviews.Content: This product was a gift for my daughter and her husband.  They have been very pleased with the pictures taken with this camera. It has been easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great small, durable camera
Reviews.Author: Sean C. Hutchins
Reviews.Content: This camera is well built and durable, great for shallow water pictures for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: I love my Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gennea P. Williams
Reviews.Content: I love my camera! It is wonderful. Truthfully I am a little scared to put it under water. I am going to wait till the summer months but I am pretty sure it will do just fine. It is wonderful though. I love the pictures and I can take it anywhere. WONDERFUL! Plus, it blue!

Reviews.Title: Great camera so far...
Reviews.Author: C. Meyer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use with lots of nice features.  Completely waterproof (so far) and takes great pics underwater.  Have not dropped it to test the anti-shock feature but Consumer Reports says it will indeed survive a 5 foot fall on cement.  I had the pentax W30 camera before this one and the picture quality from this olympus is far better.  I'd recommend this camera to anyone who needs a good quality durable point and shoot digital. Why would you NOT buy a waterproof camera?

Reviews.Title: stylish stylus
Reviews.Author: Miriam
Reviews.Content: Perfect camera for my daughter.  The first day she received it, she dove into the pool with it while filming the action.  It's compact and easy to work.  The white color stands out.  This was a great birthday present!

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Diane Saunders "dlsqtrhs"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera ~ having to get used to it & all the function but it's taking great photos!  I like that if it gets dropped, it's still going to be functional plus I tend to take some photos in dampness so being waterproof is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, easy to use and durable.
Reviews.Author: D. West "gadget junkie"
Reviews.Content: I have been a canon digital point and shoot camera guy for years. But I have kids now 3 & 1.5 and the canon had taken a beating because the kids would occasionally get a hold of it.I was drawn to the Tough - 6000 because of its ruggedness and the fact it was water proof up to 10 feet (that should take care of the little ones drool).  I was unsure of the picture quality as I have had no experience with the Olympus camera.  I was pleasantly surprised by the results.It has a number of automatic scene modes which I use quite a bit and the result has been fantastic pictures.  Couple notes, just like with any point and shoot camera the flash is not going to fill a room so trying to shoot subjects further than 10 feet in a dim room will not net the desired result, but if you keep the subjects under 10 feet you get the light you want and great results.  Outdoor pictures are very good but this will not be the camera for shooting action sports.  Just not fast enough. Also I notice the zoom is a little slower than the zoom on the canon.  With that said I still have not missed the good shoots with the small children.If you are looking for a good camera to drop in your pocket and take some good pictures at get together with friends, birthdays, and spur of the moment photos, and you want to to worry if the camera gets wet or is dropped this camera would fit that bill very well.Overall I am very happy with the purchase and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David Lieber
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  One of the specs Olympus does not advertise enough is that it supports many foreign languages in its user interface.

Reviews.Title: Great little point-n-shoot!
Reviews.Author: pengu1n
Reviews.Content: If you want a rugged, waterproof camera for taking to the beach or pool, this is the camera for you.  I normally use a DSLR, but I am happy with the quality of the pictures shot with this one both inside and out. The scene modes work well, especially the 'cuisine' mode was nice for taking pictures of food on my recent cruise, and the 'macro' mode is great for closeups.  The panorama mode is easy to use also, but sometimes, it did not correctly overlap shots or use the same exposure settings.  There are no manual shooting modes on this, you have to use the scene modes to adjust for different types of shooting.

Reviews.Title: Quality photos! Tough Camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Stroud "mimimama"
Reviews.Content: I was always a cannon girl but after my kids destroyed my last two cameras I was looking for something more durable! I have had this camera for a month now and have been nothing but satisified with the picture quality indoors and out! You have to change the settings for indoor lighting to get the best quality but it has many options for that. I also like the high speed shooting option, wonderful for sport shots and two little boys on the run!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Clyde Witt
Reviews.Content: After dunking three cameras in as many years, I opted for one that can swim. This one beats them all, above or below the surface.

Reviews.Title: Not so great!
Reviews.Author: Leslie B. Jordan "Leslie Sullins"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of the camras which stopped working after the 7 day warrenty ran out and they want let me exchange for anotherone.I called and a man told me that I'd have to call Olympus.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!
Reviews.Author: Misslyssa "Misslyssa"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Olympus shock and waterproof camera and I'm absolutely in LOVE with this brand and this camera. I'm very hard on electronics and this has sure surpassed my expectations of a camera! The quality of my pictures is wonderful. The durability of the camera is phenomenal. I can not count how many time I have dropped my old camera and dunked it in a glass of water ( sometimes on purpose just to freak people out ) and the thing keeps on working... I'm expecting the same greatness from my brand new camera and can't wait to use it!!! The customer service that Olympus provides is also fantastic! My previous camera had been sent in at least 3 times and the company fixed and returned as if they were a personal friend. :)  Also i would like to thank Amazon and butterfly photo  on the delivery time! This product was ordered on a Saturday and was received in the mail (USPS) on Wednesday!  Bottom line is GREAT WORK TO EVERYONE INVOLVED IN THE PROCESS OF MAKING ME A VERY HAPPY AND NOW LOYAL CUSTOMER!!!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME RETAILER
Reviews.Author: pilatti1
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Olympus 6000 from Electro Brands and let me tell you what AWESOME Customer Service. I have not had a chance to use it as I am off to Bermuda next week. When I return I will let you know how well this camera preformed. if it preforms as well as Electro brands then it will be a hit. They not only provide great deals but when a situation arises they are right on it (needed it shipped as quickly as possible). Which they graciously did for me. They will answer any emails as quickly as possible so you are not waiting for an answer. I just happen to be the Customer Service Manager for a very large telecommunications company so I realize how difficult customer can be BUT Electro brands is very accomodating and helpful with FAST, PROMPT, SERVICE.If anyone needs electronics do not hesitate to buy from them.....

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 6000
Reviews.Author: J. Wardell
Reviews.Content: Tough camera that takes beautiful pictures.  Easy to use.  Great if you have children who are rough or if you are accident prone :).  Water proof, drop proof and shock proof.

Reviews.Title: olympus stylus tough
Reviews.Author: bads
Reviews.Content: we were able to try the camera immediately under water. cool pictures taken. so far so good but it may be too early to tell.

Reviews.Title: lock your doors
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Well we didn't have a chance to use this product, because 1 day after giving to my daughter our house was broken into and the thieves took the camera, so if its worth stealing then it must be good...look forward to replacing it and putting it through some rigorous picture taking...

ProductInfo.Features: Olympus Stylus 6000 10MP with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom shockproof, waterproof, freezeproof, crushproof and shakeproof digital camera
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus Stylus Tough-6000 10 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)
